title: 109_hr1297
content:
The Act titled "National Vaccine Injury Compensation Program Improvement Act of 2005" amends the basis for calculating projected lost earnings under the Public Health Service Act. Earnings are determined based on the average gross weekly earnings of full-time workers, minus taxes and health insurance costs. SEC. 3 increases the award for vaccine-related death from $250,000 to $300,000. SEC. 4 allows compensation for family counseling expenses and expenses of establishing guardianship. Section 2115(a) of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include compensation for family counseling expenses and expenses of establishing guardianships in post-1988 cases related to vaccine injuries. The amendment includes compensation for family counseling expenses and costs of establishing guardianships, conservatorships, or trusts in cases related to vaccine injuries. SEC. 5. Allowing payment of interim attorneys' fees and costs. Section 2115(e) of the Public Health Service Act is amended to allow special masters to make interim awards of attorneys' fees and costs in vaccine injury cases meeting specific criteria. Special masters can make interim awards of attorneys' fees and costs in vaccine injury cases. The Secretary must promptly pay the interim award without the need for a judgment. The awarded fees and costs for compensation will be for the total incurred in any proceeding, minus the interim amount. The special master can reconsider and modify awarded fees and costs in vaccine injury cases. Procedure for paying attorneys' fees. Section 2115(e) of the Public Health Service Act allows for attorneys' fees and costs to be payable solely to the petitioner's attorney under certain conditions, such as when the petitioner cannot be located or refuses to respond to requests for information. The attorney may be reimbursed for fees and costs expeditiously under certain conditions or exceptional circumstances with good cause. SEC. 7. EXTENSION OF STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS. Section 2116(a) of the Public Health Service Act is amended to extend the limitation period for filing a petition related to vaccine injuries or deaths. The amendment changes the time frame from months to 6 years for various scenarios. The limitation period for filing a petition related to vaccine injuries or deaths is extended under section 2116(a) of the Public Health Service Act. The new time frame is the later of the applicable date under section 2116(a) or 2 years after the enactment of the Act. Additionally, a petition filed within this limitation period cannot be dismissed for untimely filing. Section 2116(b) is also amended to address claims based on revisions to the table. The limitation period for filing vaccine injury or death petitions is extended under the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is required to transmit 2 annual reports to Congress identifying the number of compensation petitions filed. The Secretary of Health and Human Services must provide two annual reports to Congress on the impact of the limitation period extension for filing vaccine injury or death petitions. The reports should detail the effects on the administration of the National Vaccine Injury Compensation Program and the timely adjudication of petitions. SEC. 8. ADVISORY COMMISSION ON CHILDHOOD VACCINES. Amends the selection criteria for public members to include individuals who have personally suffered a vaccine-related injury. Eliminates the mandatory meeting schedule requirement. SEC. 9. CONFORMING AMENDMENT TO TRUST FUND PROVISION. SEC. 9. CONFORMING AMENDMENT TO TRUST FUND PROVISION. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to update provisions related to vaccine-related injury or death. SEC. 10. INCREASE IN LIMIT ON ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. SEC. 10. INCREASE IN LIMIT ON ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to increase the limit on administrative expenses to $10,000,000 for any fiscal year. Additionally, it includes provisions for the payment of administrative and personnel expenses incurred by the Bureau of the Public Debt for financial services for the Trust Fund. SEC. 11. PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT CAMPAIGN. Amends the Public Health Service Act to include conducting a public service announcement campaign. 

SEC. 12. APPLICATION. Applies provisions and amendments to petitions filed under the Public Health Service Act if pending or filed after the enactment date of this Act.
